definition: to start a new life/to make a fresh start
heavy/serious/to attach importance to
to repeat/repetition/again/re-/classifier: layer
abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin
new/newly/meso- (chemistry)

to do/to make/to produce/to write/to compose/to act as/to engage in/to hold (a party)/to be/to become/to function (in some capacity)/to serve as/to be used for/to form (a bond or relationship)/to pretend/to feign/to act a part/to put on appearance
man/person/people/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]

sentences.english: Love is a great teacher, teach us to turn over a new leaf.
sentences.chinese: 爱是一位伟大的导师，教我们重新做人。

sentences.english: After released from prison, he was determined to turn over a new leaf.
sentences.chinese: 出狱后，他决心洗心革面，重新做人。

sentences.english: This is a new project to help ex-prisoners turn over a new leaf.
sentences.chinese: 这是一项皆在帮助出狱的犯人重新做人的新计划。

sentences.english: The longer she wallows in feelings of guilt the harder it will be for her to make a fresh start.
sentences.chinese: 她越是长期不能摆脱有罪的感觉，就越难以重新做人。

sentences.english: The only chance they'll ever have is a halfway house, that'll help them get their feet under them again.
sentences.chinese: 过渡教习所帮助他们重新做人，这是他们唯一的机会。

sentences.english: He promised me that he would stand in front of me, a thorough new man.
sentences.chinese: 他向我保证他将洗心革面，重新做人。

sentences.english: He said he would one day get out of jail.
sentences.chinese: 信中说，总有一天他会走出监狱，重新做人。

sentences.english: The longer she wallows in feelings of guilt the harder it will be for her to .
sentences.chinese: 她越是长期不能摆脱有罪的感觉，就越难以重新做人。

sentences.english: Hence forth I will be a very different Toad.
sentences.chinese: 从今以后，我一定要重新做人。

sentences.english: I am turning over a new leaf.
Give me a chance to live again.
sentences.chinese: 给我一个重新做人的机会。

sentences.english: He is now perhaps sorry for what he has done, and anxious to re-establish a character.
sentences.chinese: 也许他现在已经后悔，痛下决心，重新做人。

definition: lit. to wash one's heart and renew one's face (idiom); to repent sincerely and mend one's mistaken ways/to turn over a new leaf
to reform and start afresh (idiom); to turn over a new leaf
to repent and start afresh (idiom); to turn over a new leaf
completely correcting one's former misdeeds (idiom); to repent past mistakes and turn over a new leaf/a reformed character
to mend one's ways (idiom)/to turn over a new leaf
to get back on the right path/to mend one's ways
to renounce evil and turn to virtue (idiom)
to repent
to regret/to repent
a prodigal son returned home is worth more than gold
pinyin: lang4 zi3 hui2 tou2 jin1 bu4 huan4

definition: the return of a prodigal son (idiom)
to repent/repentance
to confess/to repent/remorse/repentance/penitent/confession (Buddhism)
to correct/to fix
(of a slave or servant) to be given one's freedom/(of a prostitute) to marry and leave one's trade
to be released from prison
